title: ActInf GuestStream 088.1 ~ Abdulrahman: What is the Limit of Our Brains in Predicting Future Events?
description:
Name: Hunar Ahmad Abdulrahman
Lecturer of Medical Physiology at Al-Kitab University, Iraq

According to the Free Energy Principle and predictive coding theories, our brain is a prediction machine. Predicting future events in a changing environment is essential for adaptation and ultimately for our survival. On the other hand, the Computational Irreducibility Principle posits that accurate prediction for the far future is impossible. So how does our brain manage to make long-term predictions possible?

https://youtu.be/TT4I2VIPYrg?
@brainxyz
